title: 1960s美国高中课堂的纪律运动模拟

action: Stand for the morning pledge with proper posture and salute
speech: I pledge allegiance to the flag of the United States of America...
thoughts: I need to follow the rules and set a good example. My family expects me to behave properly in school, and I don't want to stand out negatively.

action: Follow along in textbook and maintain proper posture
thoughts: The pledge is over and now we're starting the lesson. I need to follow along carefully in my textbook like everyone else. Mr. Johnson expects perfect attention and I don't want to stand out or get in trouble. Keeping my posture straight and following the rules is important for my standing with both the teacher and my classmates.

action: Continue taking notes from textbook discussion
thoughts: Mr. Johnson is leading a discussion about the Civil War battles on page 42. I need to keep taking careful notes and follow along like everyone else. Everyone seems to be cooperating and following the textbook instructions. I don't want to be the one who stands out or gets marked down for not paying attention. Maintaining proper posture while writing will show I'm a good student.
